brief_description: CD4+ T cells are central mediators of autoimmune pathology; however, defining their key effector functions in specific autoimmune diseases remains challenging. CD4+ T cells with high PD-1 expression are expanded in rheumatoid arthritis patients.
brief_title: Pathologically expanded peripheral B cell-helper T cells in Rheumatoid Arthritis

endpoints: CDAI, mass cytometry (CyToF) , flow cytometry, RNA Sequencing, ELISA, Intracellular cytokine staining, intracellular transcription factor staining, RT-PCR, in vitro cell stimulation assays
hypothesis: Subpopulations of CD4+ T cells associated with rheumatoid arthritis pathology can be found with multidimensional cytometry and gene expression analysis.
objectives: Identify biomarkers of subpopulations of CD4+ T cells associated with rheumatoid arthritis pathology
